name: Pixel Co-occurrence
description: Analyzes co-occurrence statistics of adjacent pixel differences to detect overly smooth gradient transitions characteristic of AI-generated images.
mechanism: Constructs co-occurrence matrices from horizontal and vertical pixel difference pairs. Measures entropy of these matrices to quantify the diversity of micro-transitions. AI images typically show lower entropy due to smoother, more predictable gradient transitions.
parameters: Difference pairs: horizontal + vertical, Quantization: 8-bit, Matrix size: 256×256, Metric: joint entropy
accuracy: Moderate — 68-80%, effective for detecting synthetic smoothness
source: Fridrich & Kodovský (2012) — Rich Models for Steganalysis of Digital Images, IEEE TIFS
useCase: Detecting synthetic micro-texture smoothness in AI-generated content

references.title: Fridrich, J. & Kodovský, J. (2012). Rich Models for Steganalysis of Digital Images. IEEE TIFS.
